name: Sale Deed
shortDescription: A sale deed acts as the legal document for evidencing sale and transfer of ownership of property in favor of the buyer.
description: A sale deed acts as the legal document for evidencing sale and transfer of ownership of property in favor of the buyer. The sale deed is the document by which a seller transfers his right on the property to the buyer. It is executed subsequent to the execution of the sale agreement.

description: Document review and consult with the Lawyer

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Sale Deed Agreement drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalize Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Parties Of The Sale Deed
content.description: The sale deed outlines the details of the parties involved. It bears the name, age and addresses of the parties (buyer and seller) involved in the transaction.

content.title: Details of the property
content.description: The details of the property are written in the deed. the details include plot area, identification number, details of construction, the exact location and surroundings of the property. The schedule of details is attached to the deed.

content.title: Consideration
content.description: The amount of consideration is stated clearly in the deed. the consideration amount is to be paid by the buyer to the seller during the execution of the deed.

content.title: Mode of payment
content.description: The deed outlines the terms of payment. The parties should decide how and when the payments shall be done.

content.title: Encumbrances
content.description: An encumbrance is a claim made against a property by someone other than the current titleholder. The encumbrance clause states that, there are no additional liens on the property.

content.title: Indemnity clause
content.description: An indemnity clause is a contractual transfer of risk between two parties. Sale deed contains indemnification clause as a mechanism to allocate risk between the parties. It contractually obligates one party to compensate another party for losses or damages.
A sale deed provides legal recognition to the transaction between the parties.
A sale deed is admissible in the court. In case of a legal dispute the deed can be used as evidence.
A sale deed defines ownership rights and safeguards the rights and interest of the parties.

faqs.question: What is the difference between agreement to sale and sale deed?
faqs.answer: The agreement of sale shows the willingness of the parties to buy/sell the property in future. A sale deed signifies an immediate transfer of the property titles.

faqs.question: Is unregistered sale deed valid?
faqs.answer: Sale Deed is invalid if not registered. It is necessary to register a sale deed.

faqs.question: I have a sale deed; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your sale deed reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the Agreement drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer: The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document.  Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
